coriell 0.5.0

    Perform p-value combination on differential expression results

    meta_pcombine.Rd

    This function aims to combine p-values and log fold-change values into a single combined p-value and logFC value for each gene across all studies. Several methods for combining p-values are included. The useer can also pass an arbitrary function to the lfc_fun argument used to summarize the logFC values across studies.

    meta_pcombine(
  exp_list,
  lfc_col = "logFC",
  pval_col = "FDR",
  gene_col = "feature_id",
  all_common = FALSE,
  lfc_fun = mean,
  method = c("fisher", "pearson", "stouffer", "tippet", "wilkinson"),
  plot = FALSE,
  plot_lfc = 0,
  plot_pval = 0.05,
  plot_labels = FALSE,
  plot_count = TRUE,
  ...
)

    Arguments

    exp_list

    list() of data.frames of differential expression results.

    lfc_col

    Column name in the expression data.frames that contains log fold-change values. default = "logFC".

    pval_col

    Column name in expression data.frames that contains the significance values. default = "FDR".

    gene_col

    Column name in the expression data.frames that contains the gene IDs. default = "feature_id".

    all_common

    Logical. Use only genes present in all experiments. default = FALSE.

    lfc_fun

    Function for summarizing logFC values across studies.

    method

    Method for combining p-values. One of c("fisher", "pearson", "stouffer", "tippet", "wilkinson"). default "fisher".

    plot

    Logical. Display a volcano plot using the combined values. default = FALSE

    plot_lfc

    Numeric. LogFC cutoff used when plotting. default = 0

    plot_pval

    Numeric. P-value cutoff used when plotting. default = 0.05.

    plot_labels

    Logical. Display labels for significant genes on plot. default = FALSE

    plot_count

    Logical. Display count of up/down genes on plot. default = TRUE

    ...

    Additional arguments passed to lfc_fun.

    Value

    data.table with columns containing the combined logFC and p-values.

    Details

    The following p-value combination methods are available:

    • fisher: Uses the sum of the logarithms for the p-values. Sensitive to very small p-values therefore a single significant study can lead to a very small combined p-value.

    • pearson: Similar to Fisher's method but sensitive to large p-values; therefore more false negatives are obtained.

    • stouffer: (not yet implemented) Recommended when weights for each study can be calculated.

    • tippet: Uses the minimum of the p-values across all studies. Recommended when the aim is to discard genes.

    • wilkinson: Uses the maximum of the p-values across all studies. Recommended when the aim is to identify the most robust genes.
